title: Black Tuesday

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of jute and wool, square knotted with cascading ends and wool pile.

medium_display: Jute and wool, square knotted with cascading ends and wool pile
publication_history:
Thomas Willis, “When String or Rope Becomes Art,” Chicago Tribune (Sept. 15, 1968) (ill.).

Whitney Halsted, “Claire Zeisler and the Sculptured Knot, Craft Horizons 28, no. 5 (Sept.–Oct. 1968): 15 (ill.).

Sculpture. Sculpture? Sculpture!, exh. cat. (Highland Park, IL: Ravinia Festival, 1969), cat. 45 (not ill.).

University of Notre Dame Contemporary Arts Festival, Contemporary Arts in the Midwest (South Bend, IL: University of Notre Dame, 1970), cat. 44.

Artweek, 2, 11 (Mar. 13, 1971): 1 (ill.).

Barbara Kastern, “Fiber Sculpture,” Art Week , 2, 12 (Mar. 20, 1971): 8.

Philadelphia Museum of Art, American Crafts (Philadelphia: Philadelphia Museum of Art, 1977), 38, 44 (ill.).

Museum of Art, Washington State University, Diverse Directions: The Fiber Arts (Pullman, WA: Washington State University, 1978), cat. 39.

Christa C. Mayer Thurman, ed., Claire Zeisler–A Retrospective, exh. cat. (Chicago: Art Institute of Chicago, 1979), 36–37, cat. 10 (ill.).
exhibition_history:
Chicago, Richard Feigen Gallery, Claire Zeisler’s Forms from Fiber, Sept. 18–Oct. 19, 1968; traveled to Richard Feigen Gallery, NY, Mar. 2–21, 1969.

Highland Park, IL, Ravinia Festival, Sculpture. Sculpture? Sculpture! Summer, 1969.

South Bend, IN, University of Notre Dame Contemporary Arts Festival, Contemporary Art in the Midwest, 1970.

Oakland, CA, California College of Arts and Crafts Gallery, Dimension in Fiber, Mar. 4–9, 1971.

NY, Hadler Galleries, Claire Zeisler, Nov. 20, 1976–Jan. 8, 1977.

Philadelphia Museum of Art, American Crafts 1977, Oct. 3–30, 1977.

Philadelphia, PA, Memorial Hall, The Philadelphia Craft Show, Nov. 3–6, 1977.

Pullman, WA, Museum of Art, Washington State University, Diverse Directions: The Fiber Arts, Oct.13–Nov. 17, 1978.

Art Institute of Chicago, Claire Zeisler–A Retrospective, Feb. 10–May 20, 1979, cat. 10.
provenance_text: With Richard Feigen Gallery, Chicago [Claire Zeisler’s Forms from Fiber 1968]. Hadler/Rodriguez Galleries, New York, and Houston, TX, by 1979 [Thurman 1979, cat. 10]. Borg-Warner Corporation, Chicago, by 1988 [Incoming permanent receipt RX17362, Aug. 12, 1988; copy in curatorial object file]; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1988.
